titlestmt.titleproper: Los Angeles County Museum records relating to the Mr. and Mrs. William Preston Harrison collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:07:24 -0400.

did.unittitle: Los Angeles County Museum records relating to the Mr. and Mrs. William Preston Harrison collections

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Los Angeles County Museum of Art

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, 1917-1973, with curators and officials of the museum, concerning the museum, collecting and the contemporary art scene; inventories; data sheets; accession cards; deeds of gift; press releases; a speech by Harrison; a research data file (222 items) including conservation reports, condition reports, and research on the history of the paintings; an inventory of books donated by Harrison to the museum library; a few photographs; letters, inventories and miscellany relating to the South Sea Collection and the Collection of Western paintings; lists of Harrison gifts and loans, 1938-1963; and miscellany.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm rolls 598-600 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Art patron and collector, Los Angeles, Calif. Collections deal with South Seas and Western paintings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: LACMA lent a group of records August 10 and August 27, 1973 and subsequently returned to LACMA. The arrangement kept by LACMA for each installment was not altered.
